title: Bismarck Range
text:
The Bismarck Range is a <a href="mountain%20range">mountain range</a> in the <a href="Western%20Highlands%20Province">Western Highlands Province</a> of <a href="Papua%20New%20Guinea">Papua New Guinea</a>. The range is named after the German Chancellor, <a href="Otto%20von%20Bismarck">Otto von Bismarck</a>. From the 1880s to 1914 this part of the island was a <a href="German%20New%20Guinea">German colony</a>.
The highest point is <a href="Mount%20Wilhelm">Mount Wilhelm</a> at 4,509 m (14,793 ft). At over 3,400 metres (11,155 ft), the landscape is <a href="Alpine%20climate">alpine</a> with <a href="tundra">tundra</a>, in spite of the tropical climate. The <a href="Ramu">Ramu</a> River has its source in the range.
